revised_title: Stable Interfacial Potentials in Polar Oil/Water Systems
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the potential differences caused by spread monolayers at polar oil/water interfaces. They found that with carefully defined experiments, stable interfacial potentials can be obtained, and the factors affecting their stability were identified. The results provide a better understanding of the behavior of monolayers at polar oil/water interfaces and help clarify the contradictory data found in previous studies.
